thread.title: FOX NATION SALUTE: Radio and TV Host and Friend, Alan Colmes, Dead at 66
thread.title_full: FOX NATION SALUTE: Radio and TV Host and Friend, Alan Colmes, Dead at 66

title: FOX NATION SALUTE: Radio and TV Host and Friend, Alan Colmes, Dead at 66
text:
FOX NATION SALUTE: Radio and TV Host and Friend, Alan Colmes, Dead at 66 Published February 23, 2017 

By Lia Eustachewich, The New York Post 
Longtime Fox News host Alan Colmes died Thursday morning after a brief illness, the network confirmed. He was 66. 
Family of the liberal pundit released a statement saying he “was a great guy, brilliant, hysterial and moral. He was fiercely loyal and the only thing he loved more than his work was his life with [wife] Jocelyn.” 
Colmes joined Fox in 1996 and was a co-host on “Hannity & Colmes.” 
He most recently hosted late night radio show “The Alan Colmes Show.” 
Colmes’ colleagues paid tribute to him on Twitter. So sad to hear of the death of Fox News colleague Alan Colmes. He and I agreed on little, but I liked him immensely. Good guy. R.I.P. — Brit Hume (@brithume) February 23, 2017 Shocked to hear of the passing of Alan Colmes. Thanks for providing great perspective on the stories of the day. — Mike Tobin (@MikeTobinFox) February 23, 2017 Very sad to report our friend and colleague @AlanColmes has passed away. — Shannon Bream (@ShannonBream) February 23, 2017 I can tell you tears r flowing @FoxBusiness @FoxNews right now. We are all devastated by the loss of kind soul @AlanColmes may god bless RIP
